comments:
This course covers perturbation theory, variational principle, application of the quantum theory to atomic, molecular, and nuclear systems, and their interaction with radiation.

In general, students felt that this was a “very good course” and is in fact “absolutely essential for any student trying to understand Quantum Mechanics.” A few students mentioned that the textbook “sometimes leaves important results as exercises,” but “Professor Soven did a nice job of providing companion materials to clarify and amend the book’s explanations.”

Students also felt that Professor Soven “clearly cares about their understanding of the material” and that he “made a great attempt to connect with the students.”

Students found the home problems and the take-home exams to be “fair” and “effective in terms of internalizing subject knowledge” but also mentioned that the course required “constant work” and “a high degree of cumulative understanding.” This review is based off of 5 responses.
